metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20266 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in RPM's hdrblobInit() in lib/header.c. This flaw allowsan attacker who can modify the rpmdb to cause an out-of-bounds read. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librpm9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmbuild9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmio9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmsign9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
python3-rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-common - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-i18n - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm2cpio - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: rpm package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.17.0+dfsg1-1').
